content: Just to let everyone know about https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/65000, in particular @mark-i-m, @Amanjeev Sethi and myself are the ones included there
to be honest, I'm not 100% sure what am I agreeing to if I click the box
I guess you agree to be pinged when the PR is reviewed?
I was going to ask that myself. Glad you raised it
@mark-i-m is the one that is more aware/knowledgeable of these things :)
IMO: As far as rustc-guide is concerned, I would agree
Sorry what is FCP/
I may be mistaken, but the topic is whether we agree or not https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/64977 ?

Sorry what is FCP/

Final Comment Period

I may be mistaken, but the topic is whether we agree or not https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/64977 ?

I guess it's if we agree and if we would like to be in the review process
but honestly unsure

Sorry what is FCP/

Final Comment Period

https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-guide/blob/master/src/implementing_new_features.md
oh thank you! I have so many acronyms at my new job and am drowning
So we wait for @mark-i-m to enlighten us? :smiley:
I'd just tick by myself, but still I'd wait for @mark-i-m to see what they think about it
I do not have permission to edit the comment. Should I ask you to do it ?
do you want me to tick on your name?
Sure! I am still not sure what impact does this have for us but ok

This is agreeing to:

if we proceed with this change, submodule changes will no longer be gated when landing into master (modulo beta week). The theory behind this is that rollups can always include all toolstate-gated submodule changes, whereas currently it's pretty much impossible.

I can answer questions if you have them.

Basically it means when you or someone else updates the rustc-guide(?) the PR updating the submodule in rust-lang/rust will land faster, but possibly won't fix test failures and such if there are test failures
I might be mistaken, but i think this is already the case for the guide.
Personally, I agree to the change (cc @simulacrum because I can't tick my box)
That's possible, yes, I think we have several tools that are like that, though I think today it's a global thing (affects beta too). Will tick your box soon
ticked
